page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Bridge of Earn grew up because the road from Edinburgh to Perth crossed the River Earn at this point, but it has recently been by-passed by the M90 which has an exit and entry point less than a kilometer south of the vilage. This makes commuting very easy.. The railway station in Bridge of Earn closed in 1965 and the land used for specialised potato storage sheds. The single track line from Fife into Perth through Bridge of Earn is still used infrequently for freight. Service buses linking Perth with Fife run through Bridge of Earn at approximately 1/2 hour intervals. Many of these buses also provide a service for the Hospital. Service has improved over the last ten years particularly through Kintillo.
